g.text: were measured with Edinburgh Instruments (FLS1000). The ballistic
transmittance of nanophosphor ﬁlms was recorded using a Cary 7000
NIR spectrophotometer. The QY values were
measured from the ratio between the light emitted and light absorbed
by the nanophosphor ﬁlms. Thus, they comprise processes from the
absorption of the excitation light by the nanophosphor matrix to the
transfer to the RE activator and the subsequent outcoupling to free
space of the emitted light. The measurements were performed using
an integrating sphere attached to FLS 1000.
The manuscript was written with contributions from all
authors. All authors have given approval to the ﬁnal version of
Spanish Ministry of Economy and Competitiveness grant
under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and
The authors declare no competing ﬁnancial interest.
This project has received funding from the European Research
Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020
agreement no. 715832) and the Spanish Ministry of Economy
